contextDescription: Introduction to object-oriented programming in Python, covering classes, instances, attributes, methods, properties, and special methods
learningObjectives: Understand why Python programming is awesome
Define what a class is and how to create one
Distinguish between class and object or instance
Understand attributes and how to use public, protected, and private attributes
Define methods and special methods in a class
Learn about properties and how they differ from attributes
Write and use getters and setters
Learn about class docstrings and how to access them
Understand attribute encapsulation and information hiding
Master operator overloading through special methods
Implement data structures using OOP principles
prerequisites: Functions and data types in Python
